data.word: Furthermore, the research shows positive results.
data.explanation: <Furthermore> adds additional information to support a point

data.word: Moreover, the costs have decreased significantly.
In addition, we need to consider the environmental impact.
Additionally, the team worked overtime.
What's more, the project finished ahead of schedule.
data.explanation: <What>s more' adds emphasis to additional information

data.word: Besides, we have other options to consider.
Also, the weather was perfect for the event.
Not only that, but the service was excellent too.
data.explanation: <Not only that> emphasizes additional positive points

data.word: However, the results were not as expected.
Nevertheless, we must continue with the plan.
On the other hand, some experts disagree.
data.explanation: <On the other hand> presents an alternative viewpoint

data.word: In contrast, the previous study showed different results.
data.explanation: <In contrast> highlights differences between two things

data.word: Although the weather was bad, we enjoyed the trip.
Despite the challenges, the project succeeded.
While some people prefer coffee, others choose tea.
data.explanation: <While> contrasts two different preferences or situations

data.word: Whereas the first option is expensive, the second is affordable.
In conclusion, the evidence supports our hypothesis.
data.explanation: <In conclusion> signals the final summary of arguments

data.word: Therefore, we recommend immediate action.
Thus, the problem has been resolved.
Consequently, sales have increased dramatically.
As a result, the company expanded globally.
data.explanation: <As a result> indicates outcome or consequence

data.word: To sum up, the meeting was very productive.
data.explanation: <To sum up> provides a brief summary

data.word: All in all, it was a successful event.
data.explanation: <All in all> gives an overall assessment

data.word: In summary, three main points were discussed.
Indeed, the results exceeded our expectations.
Certainly, this approach will be more effective.
Undoubtedly, she is the best candidate.
Obviously, we need to reconsider our strategy.
data.explanation: <Obviously> indicates something is clear or evident

data.word: Clearly, the old system was inefficient.
Without doubt, this is the right decision.
Of course, we will support your proposal.
data.explanation: <Of course> indicates something is expected or natural

data.word: Naturally, the team was disappointed.
data.explanation: <Naturally> indicates an expected or logical response

data.word: Specifically, we need to focus on customer service.
In particular, the marketing department needs attention.
Namely, John, Sarah, and Mike will lead the project.
For instance, consider the success of our last campaign.
For example, many companies use this approach.
That is to say, we need a complete restructure.
data.explanation: <That is to say> clarifies or rephrases a statement

data.word: In other words, the project has failed.
data.explanation: <In other words> provides clarification or rephrasing

data.word: To be more precise, we need exactly 50 participants.
data.explanation: <To be more precise> provides exact details

data.word: Because of the rain, the event was cancelled.
data.explanation: <Because of> indicates the reason for something

data.word: Due to technical problems, the system crashed.
data.explanation: <Due to> shows the cause of a situation

data.word: Since the weather improved, we decided to go out.
As a consequence of the delay, we missed the deadline.
data.explanation: <As a consequence of> shows the result of something

data.word: Owing to budget constraints, the project was postponed.
data.explanation: <Owing to> indicates the reason for an outcome

data.word: Thanks to your help, we completed the task on time.
